Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ```In conclusion, the komodo multichain architecture is shown to solve a previously unsolved problem of decentralized realtime gaming. Additionally, even though KMD itself is not used directly, it is required to create a pegged USDK chain, so indirectly the demand for a smart stablecoin with a built in cashier, will create demand for KMD```

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for those that keep asking why there is demand for KMD, here is another reason, but it is not taxation based, rather usage based.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the KMD pegs dont charge interest

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: But if you want to borrow against your KMD?

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: $80 for $100 KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you deposit KMD, and "borrow" up to 80%. you pay back exactly what your borrowed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no interest for the pegs mechanism

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: That's actually really big

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you do accept that if your loan ratio goes above 90%, that anybody can liquidate it

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: Let me ask you, why not 75%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however, you can replenish the balance to avoid liquidation, so i think KMD price drop that increases peoples loan ratio might increase demand for KMD to prevent liquidations

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: Borrow $75 for $100 collateral

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it can be any percent, we chose 80%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that seemed the largest it can be while still allowing the overall system to rebalance

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: I only asked bc it just leaves you 10 percent.. but that makes it very interesting as well

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: Anyone can liquidate anything over 90%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, 5% to the liquidator, 5% to the system

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: actually a bit more than 5% to the liquidator, there is an incentive to liquidate as soon as it is over 90%

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: I want to start to talk to others about this. Do you have an idea, an estimate, od when it will be live?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: each liquidation makes the overall balance that much better

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: Or replenish and bring it back down

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: Depending on price of KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: #cc-pegs is discussing the actual testing of a pegged chain tied to ounce of GOLD, it is the same mechanism as for USD, also a BTC equivalent that will have 1 minute blocks and 0,0001 txfee

Content: we just started testing it, so not sure how long it will be before it is live, we also are starting to implement the FSM CC, with cashier FSM as a specific usecase of it. Also needing a gui... i guess it will be next year before it is all working smoothly

Content: i dont know the exact amount, but the total demand is many multiples of KMD marketcap, so it is not an insignificant amount. how much of that we can capture would depend on ease of use, it would have on of the lowest rakes

Content: prices CC can be used for betting on prices of synthetics

Author: jl777c#5810

Content: The decentralized betting and prediction market is a very underrated technology! Even developers can go exponentially
